children.name: mentally ill b2
children.definition: mentally ill sb who is mentally ill has an illness of the mind which affects the way that they behave:tâm thần
examples: many of these homeless people have been mentally ill at some time.
the mentally illpeople who are mentally ill
he works in a hostel for the mentally ill.

children.name: mental b2
children.definition: mental connected with mental illness or people who are mentally ill:thuộc tâm thần , thần kinh
examples: mental hospital/patient/institution
a hospital ward for non-violent mental patients
mental problem/disorder/breakdown
we knew she had been having mental problems.

children.name: insane c2
children.definition: insaneformalpermanently and seriously mentally ill, so that you cannot have a normal life - use this inlegalcontextsor indescriptionsof people who lived in the past:điên
examples: the man, who has attacked 13 women, was judged to be insane.
for the last ten years of his life he wasclinicallyinsane.
go insanebecome seriously mentally ill
sometimes i thought i was going insane.

children.name: crazy a2
children.definition: maduk b1crazyespecially us  mentally ill - use this in conversations or stories, but not in formal, medical, or legal english: điên
examples: we soon realized that the old man was completely mad.
there’s this crazy woman in our town who eats glass.
go mad/crazy
they say she went mad after her family were killed in a fire.

children.name: unstable x
children.definition: unstable if sb is unstable, their emotional state often changes very suddenly, and they are likely to become angry, violent etc: bất ổn
examples: working with clare every day, i began to realize how unstable she was.
emotionally/mentally unstable
he is emotionally unstable, and his aggressive attitude often culminates in violence.

children.name: confused b1
children.definition: confused an old person who is confused has become mentally ill so that they cannot remember things or think clearly:lẫn thẫn
examples: aunt clara had been so sharp, so witty, but now she is just a sad, confused old woman.

children.name: nervous breakdown b2
children.definition: have a (nervous) breakdown/hæv ə (ˌnɜːʳvəs) ˈbreɪkdaʊn/  to become mentally ill, usually as a result of working too hard or difficult emotional problems, and be temporarily unable to deal with ordinary things such as working or looking after your family:
examples: suy nhược thần kinh
▪ after her divorce, dora had a nervous breakdown and was off work for three months.
▪ she sounds really bad. i think she’s heading for a nervous breakdown.
breakdownnounillness sự hỏng, bệnh
[ c ] a nervous breakdown

children.name: crack up c2
children.definition: crack up/ˌkræk ˈʌp/  informal to suddenly become unable to continue your normal life, especially because you have been working too hard or doing something that is very frightening, dangerous etc:
examples: kiệt sức, suy sụp
▪ i think paul’s cracking up under the strain of work.
▪ some people can’t cope with the death of a loved one, and simply crack up.
crack upphrasal verbinformal
to become mentally ill
_i think she's cracking up.

children.name: go insane c2
children.definition: go insanealsogomadbritish /go crazyespecially american /gəʊ ɪnˈseɪn, gəʊ ˈmæd, gəʊ ˈkreɪzi/  to become seriously and permanently mentally ill - used in ordinary english, but not official or medical contexts:
examples: điên, điên cuồng, mất trí
▪ eventually, rejected by hamlet, ophelia goes mad and drowns herself.
▪ i wondered if i was going crazy. everyone seemed to be against me.
▪ conditions on the oil rig are very unpleasant. you’d go insane if you had to stay more than a month or so.

children.name: sane c2
children.definition: sane not mentally ill, so that you are able to make sensible decisions and lead your life in a normal way: lành mạnh, không điên
examples: of course he isn’t mad. he’s as sane as you or i.
no sane person would believe such garbage!
perfectly sanecompletely sane
to his neighbours, peter appeared perfectly sane.
sanity[u] when you are mentally healthy:lành mạnh
if you have your health and your sanity, money isn’t really important.
i began to doubt donald’s sanity as his story got stranger and stranger.

children.name: of sound mind x
children.definition: of sound mind a legal expression meaning not mentally ill and able to be responsible for your decisions and actions:tỉnh táo, minh mẫn
examples: you are allowed to vote only if you are over 18 and of sound mind.
be of sound/unsound mindlegal
to not be mentally ill/ to be mentally ill

children.name: well-balanced c1
children.definition: well balanced describes sb who is calm and reasonable and who shows good judgment:
examples: [attri]happy, well-balanced children.

children.name: sb who imagines they are ill
hypochondriac x
children.definition: hypochondriac/ˌhaɪpəˈkɒndriækǁ-ˈkɑːn-/  someone who often thinks that they are ill when they are not and worries too much about their health:
examples: người mắc chứng nghi bệnh, bệnh tưởng
▪ don’t be such a hypochondriac - it’s only a cold!
▪ she’s a bit of a hypochondriac - always looking up her minor illnesses in a medical book.

children.name: mental illness x
children.definition: mental illness an illness of the mind:bệnh tâm thần
examples: depression is a mental illness and can often be treated with drugs.
he had a history of mental illness and alcoholism.
suffer from (a) mental illness
saneline is the first helpline for people suffering from mental illness.

children.name: madness x
children.definition: madness/ˈmædnɪs, ˈmædnəs/  especially british serious and permanent mental illness - used especially in literature, but not used in official or medical contexts:
examples: chứng điên rồ, sự mất trí, sự giận giữ
▪ by the end of the book, peter’s addiction has led him to madness and suicide.
feign madnesspretend to be mad
giả điên
▪ some prisoners feigned madness so that they would be released.

children.name: insanity x
children.definition: insanity/ɪnˈsænɪti, ɪnˈsænəti/  formal serious and permanent mental illness - use this especially in legal contexts or in descriptions of people who lived in the past:
examples: sự điên rồ, tình trạng mất trí
▪ hearing voices inside your head is a common symptom of insanity.
▪ hodge was found not guilty by reason of insanity.
insanitynoun[ u ]
when someone is seriously mentally ill
_he was found not guilty of murder by reason of insanity.
_he suffered from periodicbouts ofinsanity.

children.name: disorder c1
children.definition: disorder formal a mental illness - used especially by doctors:rối loạn
examples: personality/mood disorder
children who suffer from personality disorders often receive little or no treatment until it’s too late.
psychiatric/mental disorder
there was no evidence of her having a psychiatric disorder, although it was clear that she had become withdrawn since the breakup of her relationship.

children.name: depression b2
children.definition: depression a mental illness which makes you so anxious and unhappy that you cannot live a normal life: trầm cảm
examples: suffer from depression
he has been suffering from depression since his wife died last year.
deep/severe depression
she suffers from periods of deep depression, when she locks herself away and will speak to noone for weeks.

children.name: senility x
children.definition: senility/sɪˈnɪlɪti, sɪˈnɪləti/  a mental illness that affects old people and makes them unable to think clearly and become confused very easily:
examples: tình trạng suy yếu vì tuổi già
▪ of all the associated problems to do with getting old, senility is the one she dreads most.

children.name: normality c2
children.definition: normalitynoun (us alsonormalcy) trạng thái bình thường
examples: the state of being normal
_now that the civil war is over, relative normality has returned to the south of the country.

children.name: self-awareness c2
children.definition: self-awarenessnoun tự ý thức
examples: good knowledge and judgment about yourself

children.name: disturbed c2
children.definition: disturbedadjective bối rối
examples: not thinking or behaving normally because of mental or emotional problems
_a centre foremotionally/mentallydisturbed teenagers

children.name: unbalanced c2
children.definition: unbalancedadjectivementally ill
examples: mentally ill
_his relatives have said he became unbalanced after the death of his father.

children.name: wreck c2
children.definition: wrecknoun người suy nhược, tàn phế
examples: informalsomeone who is in bad physical or mental condition
_the stress she had been under at work reduced her to anervous/quiveringwreck.

children.name: scar c1
children.definition: scarnoun xẹo
examples: a sign of damage to a person's mental state
_his early years in the refugee camplefta deeppsychologicalscar.

children.name: complex c2
children.definition: complexnounbad feeling phức tạp, rắc rối
examples: a particularanxietyor unconscious fear which a person has, especially as a result of an unpleasant experience that they have had in the past or because they have a low opinion of their own worth, and which influences their behaviour
_an inferiority complex
_i think he'sgota complexaboutbeing bald.
_don't go on about her weight - you'llgiveher a complex!

children.name: autism x
children.definition: autismnoun rối loạn tự kỷ
examples: a failure to develop social abilities, language and other communication skills to the usuallevel
_autism is four times more common in boys than in girls.
autisticadjective chứng tự kỷ
_one child in 5 000 is autistic.

children.name: bulimia x
children.definition: bulimianoun chứng cuồng ăn
examples: a mental illness in which someone eats in an uncontrolled way and in large amounts, then vomits to remove the food from their body
bulimicnoun[ c ] ,adjective

children.name: anorexia (nervosa) x
children.definition: anorexia (nervosa)noun chứng biến ăn
examples: a serious illness often resulting in dangerous weight loss,in which a person, especially agirl or woman, does noteat, or eats too little, because they fear becoming fat
_reports of anorexia and other eating disorders are on the increase, with 6000 new cases in theukevery year.
anorexicadjective(alsoanorectic) biến ăn
suffering from or relating to anorexia
_she looks anorexic to me.
anorexicnoun[ c ] (alsoanorectic) người bị biến ăn
a person who suffers from anorexia
_anorexics tend to be obsessional and perfectionist.

children.name: eating disorder x
children.definition: eating disordernoun
examples: a mental illness in which people eat far too little or far too much food and are unhappywith their bodies
